Pneumococcal infection is a major cause of morbidity and mortality in elderly people. In developed countries, the annual incidence rate of IPD is approximately 8‐34/100 000, whereas in people aged ≥65 years it is approximately 24‐85/100 000.
45 The mortality rates of pneumococcal bacteremia are reportedly 16%‐36% in all adults
46 and 20%‐40% in older patients.
